intro: Spergularia langei, commonly known as the Lange's sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, clustered flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Spergularia langei plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is considered a rare and endemic species in some areas.
